Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Theoretic \The`o*ret"ic\, Theoretical \The`o*ret"ic*al\, a. [Gr. ?: cf. L. theoreticus, F. th['e]or['e]tique.] Pertaining to theory; depending on, or confined to, theory or speculation; speculative; terminating in theory or speculation: not practical; as, theoretical learning; theoretic sciences. -- {The`o*ret"ic*al*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]

theoretical adj 1: concerned primarily with theories or hypotheses rather than practical considerations; "theoretical science" [syn: {theoretic}] [ant: {empirical}] 2: concerned with theories rather than their practical applications; "theoretical physics" [ant: {applied}] 3: based on specialized theory; "a theoretical analysis" [syn: {abstract}]
